queue.fact_text: In 1066, a mob in Granada stormed the royal palace, crucified the Jewish vizier Joseph ibn Naghrela, and massacred much of the city’s Jewish community. queue.fact_text: In 1916, Charles IV and Zita were crowned in Budapest in what became the final coronation of a Hungarian monarch. The ceremony, steeped in medieval ritual with sacred crown and oaths, unfolded even as the First World War was quietly eroding the empire beneath their feet.
